wjhk.jupload2.filedata
Class PictureFileData

java.lang.Object
  wjhk.jupload2.filedata.FileData
      wjhk.jupload2.filedata.PictureFileData
public class PictureFileData
extends FileData

This class contains all data for files to upload a picture. It adds the following elements to the FileData class :

  • Ability to define a target format (to convert pictures to JPG before upload, for instance)
  • Optionnal definition of a maximal width and/or height.
  • Ability to rotate a picture, with addRotation(int)
  • Ability to store a picture into a BufferedImage. This is actualy a bad idea within an applet (should run within a java application) : the applet runs very quickly out of memory. With pictures from my Canon EOS20D (3,5M), I can only display two pictures. The third one generates an out of memory error, despiste the System.finalize and System.gc I've put everywhere in the code!

Author:
Etienne Gauthier

Field Detail

isPicture

private boolean isPicture
Indicates if this file is a picture or not.

bufferedImage

private java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage
bufferedImage contains a preloaded picture. This buffer is used according to PictureFileDataPolicy.createBufferedImage.

See Also:
PictureUploadPolicy.createBufferedImage

offscreenImage

private java.awt.Image offscreenImage
This picture is precalculated, and stored to avoid to calculate it each time the user select this picture again.

quarterRotation

int quarterRotation
quarterRotation contains the current rotation that will be applied to the picture.

originalWidth

int originalWidth
Width of the original picture.

originalHeight

int originalHeight
Width of the original picture.

transformedPictureFile

private java.io.File transformedPictureFile
transformedPictureFile contains the reference to the temporary file that stored the transformed picture, during upload. It is created by getInputStream() and freed by afterUpload().

uploadLength

private long uploadLength
uploadLength contains the uploadLength, which is :
- The size of the original file, if no transformation is needed.
- The size of the transformed file, if a transformation were made.
It is se to -1 whenever the user ask for a rotation (current only action that need to recalculate the picture.

hasToTransformPicture

private java.lang.Boolean hasToTransformPicture
hasToTransformPicture indicates whether the tranform should be transformed. Null if unknown. This can happen (for instance) if no calcul where done (during initialization), or after rotating the picture back to the original orientation.

uploadPolicy

PictureUploadPolicy uploadPolicy
For this class, the UploadPolicy is a PictureUploadPolicy.

getTransformedPictureFile

private java.io.File getTransformedPictureFile()
                                        throws JUploadException
Creation of a temporary file, that contains the transformed picture. For instance, it can be resized, rotated...

Throws:
JUploadException

getUploadLength

public long getUploadLength()
                     throws JUploadException
Calculate the number of bytes, for this upload. If needed, a temporary file is created, to store the transformed picture.

Overrides:
getUploadLength in class FileData
Returns:
The length of upload. In this class, this is ... the size of the file !
Throws:
JUploadException
See Also:
PictureFileData

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
                                   throws java.io.IOException,
                                          JUploadException
This function create an input stream for this file. The caller is responsible for closing this input stream.
This function assumes that the getUploadLength() method has already be called : it is responsible for creating the temporary file (if needed). If not called, the original file will be sent.

Overrides:
getInputStream in class FileData
Returns:
An inputStream
Throws:
java.io.IOException
JUploadException

afterUpload

public void afterUpload()
Description copied from class: FileData
This function is called after upload, whether it is successful or not. It allows fileData to free any resssource created for the upload.

Overrides:
afterUpload in class FileData
See Also:
FileData.afterUpload()

getBufferedImage

private java.awt.image.BufferedImage getBufferedImage()
                                               throws JUploadException
This function resize the picture, if necessary, according to the maxWidth and maxHeight of fileDataPolicy. This function should only be called if isPicture is true.

Returns:
A BufferedImage which contains the picture according to current parameters (resizing, rotation...).
Throws:
JUploadException

getImage

public java.awt.Image getImage(java.awt.Canvas canvas,
                               boolean shadow)
                        throws JUploadException
This method creates a new Image, from the current picture. The resulting width and height will be less or equal than the given maximum width and height. The scale is maintained. Thus the width or height may be inferior than the given values.

Parameters:
canvas - The canvas on which the picture will be displayed.
shadow - True if the pictureFileData should store this picture. False if the pictureFileData instance should not store this picture. Store this picture avoid calculating the image each time the user selects it in the file panel.
Returns:
The rescaled image.
Throws:
JUploadException

addRotation

public void addRotation(int quarter)
This function is used to rotate the picture.

Parameters:
quarter - Number of quarters (90°) the picture should rotate. 1 means rotating of 90° clockwise (?). Can be negative.

hasToTransformPicture

boolean hasToTransformPicture()
                        throws JUploadException
This function indicate if the picture has to be modified. For instance : a maximum width, height, a target format...

Returns:
true if the picture must be transformed. false if the file can be directly transmitted.
Throws:
JUploadException
See Also:
PictureUploadPolicy, quarterRotation

tooBigPicture

private void tooBigPicture()
This picture is called when an OutOfMemoryError occurs. This can easily happen within the navigator, with big pictures: I've put a lot of freeMemory calls within the code, but they doesn't seem to work very well. When running from eclipse, the memory is freed Ok !
